subtitleNullable: Titles and Statistics of YouTube Videos to classify them as Clickbait or not
descriptionNullable:
Using the YouTube API, I hand picked 100 videos as clickbait (misleading) and not clickbait. My API script downloaded each video's title, thumbnail, and various important statistics into a csv file. Thumbnails were also saved into zip files with the video id in the file names. 

This dataset is to be used for a binary classification task. Add an extra column to both csv's with all 1's for clickbait.csv and all 0's for notClickbait.csv.
As for the zip files of images, each image name is: [video id___video title], so that each thumbnail photo can be linked to its respective video.
Link for image zips (kaggle won't let me upload them):
[Clickbait thumbnails](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1JDzcBlf--xQJA9HxdCtIPxgn_MhNCyc5/view?usp=sharing)
[NonClickbait thumbnails](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1D8GQI4LpOLvnLtF2UYxc84ruq7fXL49u/view?usp=sharing)
title: YouTube Clickbait Classification
